## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 298, 301, 314]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Theory (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[90, 338, 415, 375]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper. No Additional Materials are required.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[90, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 432]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 320, 446]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 255, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 359, 530]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 530, 767, 560]]<|/det|>
You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 604, 585]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 757, 600]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A defibrillator is a machine that sends an electrical charge through the heart of a patient whose heart is not beating correctly. Doctors learn to use a defibrillator by practising on a medical dummy.

<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Thorium-234 ( \(^{234}_{90}\mathrm {Th})\) is radioactive. It decays by \(\beta \text {-}\) emission to form an isotope of protactinium (Pa).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 117, 144, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 117, 529, 136]]<|/det|>
Complete the nuclide equation for this decay.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[247, 158, 747, 212]]<|/det|>
\[^{234}_{90}\mathrm {Th}\longrightarrow \mathrm {}^{...}\mathrm {Pa}+\mathrm {}^{...}\beta\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 212, 920, 231]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 243, 146, 262]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 243, 868, 278]]<|/det|>
A pure sample of thorium-234 emits \(\beta\) -particles at a count rate of 2480 counts/second. The half-life of thorium-234 is 24 days.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 289, 920, 324]]<|/det|>
Calculate the count rate for the emission of \(\beta\) -particles from the thorium in the sample after 72 days have passed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[495, 413, 920, 433]]<|/det|>
<form>count rate ....................................................... [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 445, 144, 464]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 445, 920, 479]]<|/det|>
The isotope of protactinium in **(a)** is also radioactive. It decays by \(\beta\) -emission and has a half-life of 70 seconds.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 491, 920, 526]]<|/det|>
State and explain how this would affect the **observed** count rate for the sample in **(b)** after 72 days.
